Package com.example.group1hrmsapp.service

Class BenefitServiceImpl

java.lang.Object
com.example.group1hrmsapp.service.BenefitServiceImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
BenefitService
@Service
public class BenefitServiceImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements BenefitService
A service class that implements the BenefitService interface to provide core Benefit-related functionalities. This service is responsible for handling all operations related to Benefit objects, such as retrieving, saving, and deleting Benefits from the repository.

    • createBenefit

      public void createBenefit​(Benefit benefit)
      Creates and stores a new Benefit entry into the database. Before adding the benefit, the method checks if the logged-in user has the necessary privileges to create a benefit by checking their special type. Only users with the special type "HR" are allowed to create new benefits.
      Specified by:
      createBenefit in interface BenefitService
      Parameters:
      benefit - The benefit object to be saved into the database.
      Throws:
      java.lang.RuntimeException - If no user is currently logged in or if the logged-in user doesn't have the HR special type.

      Parameters:

      Returns:

      Throws:
      java.lang.RuntimeException - if the benefit is not found

    • enrollInBenefit

      public boolean enrollInBenefit​(java.lang.Long benefitId)
      Allows an authenticated user to enroll in a specific benefit identified by the benefitId.

      This method first retrieves the currently authenticated user from the security context. It then fetches the benefit from the repository using the given benefitId. If the logged-in employee isn't already enrolled in the specified benefit, the method enrolls the employee in the benefit by adding the benefit to the employee's benefit list with the current date as the enrollment date.

      Specified by:
      enrollInBenefit in interface BenefitService
      Parameters:
      benefitId - The unique identifier of the benefit to enroll in.
      Returns:
      true if the enrollment was successful; false if the employee was already enrolled.
      Throws:
      java.lang.RuntimeException - If no user is currently logged in.
      java.util.NoSuchElementException - If there's no benefit with the specified benefitId in the repository.

    • withdrawFromBenefit

      public boolean withdrawFromBenefit​(java.lang.Long benefitId)
      Allows an authenticated user to withdraw from a specific benefit identified by the benefitId.

      This method first retrieves the currently authenticated user from the security context. It then fetches the benefit from the repository using the provided benefitId. If the logged-in employee is currently enrolled in the specified benefit, the method withdraws the employee from the benefit by removing the benefit from the employee's benefit list.

      Specified by:
      withdrawFromBenefit in interface BenefitService
      Parameters:
      benefitId - The unique identifier of the benefit to withdraw from.
      Returns:
      true if the withdrawal was successful; false if the employee wasn't enrolled in the benefit.
      Throws:
      java.lang.RuntimeException - If no user is currently logged in.
      java.util.NoSuchElementException - If there's no benefit with the specified benefitId in the repository.

    • findPaginated

      public org.springframework.data.domain.Page<Benefit> findPaginated​(int pageNo, int pageSize, java.lang.String sortField, java.lang.String sortDirection)
      Returns a paginated view of the benefits.
      Specified by:
      findPaginated in interface BenefitService
      Parameters:
      pageNo - the page number
      pageSize - the number of benefits per page
      sortField - the field to sort by
      sortDirection - the direction to sort by (ASC or DESC)
      Returns:
      a page of benefits

    • findFilteredAndPaginated

      public org.springframework.data.domain.Page<Benefit> findFilteredAndPaginated​(org.springframework.data.jpa.domain.Specification<Benefit> spec, org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable)
      Retrieves a paginated list of benefits that match the provided specification criteria.

      This method is used to obtain a subset of benefits based on filter criteria defined in the specification and also limits the results based on pagination parameters.

      Specified by:
      findFilteredAndPaginated in interface BenefitService
      Parameters:
      spec - The specification criteria used to filter benefits. This encapsulates the conditions for querying the database.
      pageable - The pagination information including page size, page number, and sort order.
      Returns:
      A page of benefits that match the provided criteria.

    • prepareSpecification

      public org.springframework.data.jpa.domain.Specification<Benefit> prepareSpecification​(java.lang.String coverageType, java.lang.String benefitName, java.lang.Double benefitCost, java.lang.String coverageProvider)
      Prepares a JPA Specification for the Benefit entity based on the provided filter criteria.

      This method creates a dynamic JPA Specification using the provided filter criteria. The filters include: coverage type, benefit name, benefit cost, and the coverage provider. It builds a predicate for each non-null criterion and ultimately combines them using the AND logical operator. This dynamic specification can be used for querying and filtering the Benefit entities from the database based on the specified criteria.

      Specified by:
      prepareSpecification in interface BenefitService
      Parameters:
      coverageType - The type of coverage (e.g. HEALTH, DENTAL, VISION, etc.). Can be null.
      benefitName - The name of the benefit. Can be null.
      benefitCost - The maximum cost associated with the benefit. Can be null.
      coverageProvider - The provider offering the coverage (e.g. AETNA, HUMANA, etc.). Can be null.
      Returns:
      A Specification that can be used for querying Benefit entities based on the provided criteria.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If an invalid value for coverageType or coverageProvider is provided.

    • getLoggedInUser

      public Employee getLoggedInUser()
      Retrieves the Employee object associated with the currently authenticated user.

      This method fetches the current user's authentication details from the security context, and then fetches the corresponding AppUser from the database. It finally returns the associated Employee object.

      Specified by:
      getLoggedInUser in interface BenefitService
      Returns:
      The Employee object associated with the currently logged-in user.
      Throws:
      java.lang.RuntimeException - If no user is currently authenticated or logged in.
